member.name: T:Parse.ParseAnalytics
member.summary:
Provides an interface to Parse's logging and analytics backend.
Methods will return immediately and cache requests (along with timestamps) to be handled in the background.

member.name: M:Parse.ParseAnalytics.TrackAppOpenedAsync
member.summary: Tracks this application being launched.
member.returns: An Async Task that can be waited on or ignored.

member.name: M:Parse.ParseAnalytics.TrackEventAsync(System.String)
member.param: The name of the custom event to report to ParseClient as having happened.
member.returns: An Async Task that can be waited on or ignored.

member.name: M:Parse.ParseAnalytics.TrackEventAsync(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.param: The name of the custom event to report to ParseClient as having happened.
The dictionary of information by which to segment this event.
member.returns: An Async Task that can be waited on or ignored.

member.name: M:Parse.ParseAnalytics.TrackAppOpenedWithPushHashAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Private method, used by platform-specific extensions to report an app-open to the server.
member.param: An identifying hash for a given push notification, passed down from the server.
member.returns: An Async Task that can be waited on or ignored.

member.name: M:Parse.ParseAnalytics.TrackAppOpens(Microsoft.Phone.Controls.PhoneApplicationFrame)
member.param: The RootFrame of the Application.

member.name: T:Parse.ParseFacebookUtils
member.summary: Provides a set of utilities for using Parse with Facebook.

member.name: M:Parse.ParseFacebookUtils.Initialize(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes Facebook for use with Parse.
member.param: Your Facebook application ID.

member.name: M:Parse.ParseFacebookUtils.LogInAsync(System.String,System.String,System.DateTime,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Logs in a using Facebook for authentication. If a user for the given Facebook credentials does not already exist, a new user will be created.
member.param: The user's Facebook ID.
A valid access token for the user.
The expiration date of the access token.
The cancellation token.
member.returns: The user that was either logged in or created.

member.name: M:Parse.ParseFacebookUtils.LogInAsync(System.String,System.String,System.DateTime)

member.param: The user's Facebook ID.
A valid access token for the user.
The expiration date of the access token.
member.returns: The user that was either logged in or created.

member.summary: Links a to a Facebook account, allowing you to use Facebook for authentication, and providing access to Facebook data for the user.
member.param: The user to link to a Facebook account.
The user's Facebook ID.
A valid access token for the user.
The expiration date of the access token.
The cancellation token.

member.param: The user to link to a Facebook account.
The user's Facebook ID.

The expiration date of the access token.

member.name: M:Parse.ParseFacebookUtils.IsLinked(Parse.ParseUser)
member.summary: Gets whether the given user is linked to a Facebook account. This can only be used on the currently authorized user.
member.param: The user to check.
member.returns: true if the user is linked to a Facebook account.

member.name: M:Parse.ParseFacebookUtils.UnlinkAsync(Parse.ParseUser,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Unlinks a user from a Facebook account. Unlinking a user will save the user's data.
member.param: The user to unlink.
The cancellation token.

member.name: M:Parse.ParseFacebookUtils.UnlinkAsync(Parse.ParseUser)
member.summary: Unlinks a user from a Facebook account. Unlinking a user will save the user's data.
member.param: The user to unlink.

member.name: M:Parse.ParseFacebookUtils.GetProductId
member.summary: Fetches the app's ProductID from its manifest.

member.name: M:Parse.ParseFacebookUtils.IsLogInRedirect(System.Uri)
member.returns: true iff the Uri is a Facebook login redirect, false otherwise

member.name: M:Parse.ParseFacebookUtils.EndLogInAsync(System.Object,System.Windows.Navigation.NavigatingCancelEventArgs,System.Uri)
member.param: The sender for the Navigating event.
The Navigating event args.
The Uri within your app to redirect to.
member.returns: The ParseUser created or logged in using Facebook credentials, or null if this was not a Facebook login redirect.

members.member:
Logs in a using Facebook for authentication. If a user for the given Facebook credentials does not already exist, a new user will be created.
The user will be logged in through the Facebook app's single sign-on mechanism.
You must add a handler to your RootFrame's Navigating event that calls EndLogInAsync so that ParseFacebookUtils can handle incoming navigation attempts. = A list of Facebook permissions to request.

member.name: M:Parse.ParseFacebookUtils.LogInAsync(Microsoft.Phone.Controls.WebBrowser,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Logs in a using Facebook for authentication. If a user for the given Facebook credentials does not already exist, a new user will be created.
The user will be logged in through Facebook's OAuth web flow, so you must supply a that will be navigated to Facebook's authentication pages.
member.param: A web view that will be used to present the authorization pages to the user.
A list of Facebook permissions to request.
The cancellation token.
member.returns: The user that was either logged in or created.

member.name: M:Parse.ParseFacebookUtils.LinkAsync(Parse.ParseUser,Microsoft.Phone.Controls.WebBrowser,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Links a to a Facebook account, allowing you to use Facebook for authentication, and providing access to Facebook datta for the user.
The user will be logged in through Facebook's OAuth web flow, so you must supply a that will be navigated to Facebook's authentication pages.
member.param: The user to link with Facebook.
A web view that will be used to present the authorization pages to the user.
A list of Facebook permissions to request.
The cancellation token.

member.name: M:Parse.ParseFacebookUtils.LogInAsync(Microsoft.Phone.Controls.WebBrowser,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary:

The user will be logged in through Facebook's OAuth web flow, so you must supply a that will be navigated to Facebook's authentication pages.
member.param: A web view that will be used to present the authorization pages to the user.

member.returns: The user that was either logged in or created.

member.name: P:Parse.ParseFacebookUtils.AccessToken
member.summary: Gets the access token for the currently logged in Facebook user. This can be used with a Facebook SDK to get access to Facebook user data.

member.name: P:Parse.PlatformHooks.ApplicationSettings
member.summary: Provides a dictionary that gets persisted on the filesystem between runs of the app. This is analogous to NSUserDefaults in iOS.

member.name: T:Parse.PlatformHooks.SettingsWrapper
member.summary: Wraps the custom settings object for Parse so that it can be exposed as ApplicationSettings.

member.summary: Extract the JSON dictionary used to send this push.

member.returns: The JSON dictionary used to send this push.

member.param: The args parameter passed to OnNavigatedTo
member.returns: The JSON dictionary used to send this push.

member.name: M:Parse.ParsePush.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a push which will target every device. The Data field must be set before calling SendAsync.

member.name: M:Parse.ParsePush.SendAsync
member.summary: Request a push to be sent. When this task completes, Parse has successfully acknowledged a request to send push notifications but has not necessarily finished sending all notifications requested. The current status of recent push notifications can be seen in your Push Notifications console on http://parse.com

member.name: M:Parse.ParsePush.SendAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Request a push to be sent. When this task completes, Parse has successfully acknowledged a request to send push notifications but has not necessarily finished sending all notifications requested. The current status of recent push notifications can be seen in your Push Notifications console on http://parse.com
member.param: CancellationToken to cancel the current operation.

member.param: The alert message to send.

member.param: The alert message to send.
An Installation must be subscribed to channel to receive this Push Notification.

An Installation must be subscribed to any of channels to receive this Push Notification.

member.name: E:Parse.ParsePush.ToastNotificationReceived
member.summary: An event fired when a push notification of any type (i.e. toast, tile, badge, or raw) is received.

member.name: E:Parse.ParsePush.PushNotificationReceived
member.summary: A generic event handler for notifications of all types. Because this event is also fired when a raw notification is sent, the event args are very hard to use. You only get a byte stream! We'll reveal this publicly once we support raw notifications; in the meantime we should leave ToastNotificationReceived as the golden road.

member.name: P:Parse.ParsePush.Query
member.summary: An installation query that specifies which installations shoudl receive this push. This should not be used in tandem with Channels.

member.name: P:Parse.ParsePush.Channels
P:Parse.ParsePush.Expiration
member.summary: The time at which this push will expire. This should not be used in tandem with ExpirationInterval.

member.name: P:Parse.ParsePush.ExpirationInterval
member.summary: The time from initial schedul when this push will expire. This should not be used in tandem with Expiration.

member.name: P:Parse.ParsePush.Data
member.summary: The contents of this push. Some keys have special meaning. A full list of pre-defined keys can be found in the Parse Push Guide. The following keys affect WinRT devices. Keys which do not start with x-winrt- can be prefixed with x-winrt- to specify an override only sent to winrt devices. alert: the body of the alert text. title: The title of the text. x-winrt-payload: A full XML payload to be sent to WinRT installations instead of the auto-layout. This should not be used in tandem with Alert.

member.name: P:Parse.ParsePush.Alert
T:Parse.ParseInstallation
member.summary: Represents this app installed on this device. Use this class to track infomation you want to sample from (i.e. if you update a field on app launch, you can issue a query to see the number of devices which were active in the last N hours).

member.name: F:Parse.ParseInstallation.currentInstallationMatchesDisk
member.summary: Whether the currentInstallation is known to match the serialized version on disk. This is useful for saving a filesystem check if you try to load currentInstallation frequently while there is none on disk.

member.name: M:Parse.ParseInstallation.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new ParseInstallation. Generally, you should not need to construct ParseInstallations yourself. Instead use .

member.name: F:Parse.ParseInstallation.tzNameMap
member.summary: This mapping of Windows names to a standard everyone else uses is maintained by the Unicode consortium, which makes this officially the first helpful interaction between Unicode and Microsoft. Unfortunately this is a little lossy in that we only store the first mapping in each zone because Microsoft does not give us more granular location information. Built from http://unicode.org/repos/cldr-tmp/trunk/diff/supplemental/zone_tzid.html

member.name: F:Parse.ParseInstallation.toastChannelTag
member.summary: Future proofing: Right now there's only one valid channel for the app, but we will likely want to allow additional channels for auxiliary tiles (i.e. a contacts app can have a new channel for each contact and the UI needs to pop up on the right tile). The expansion job generically has one _Installation field it passes to device-specific code, so we store a map of tag -> channel URI. Right now, there is only one valid tag and it is automatic. Unsed variable warnings are suppressed becaue this const is used in WinRT and WinPhone but not NetFx.

member.name: M:Parse.ParseInstallation.GetAppAttribute(System.String)
member.summary: Gets an attribute from the Windows Phone App Manifest App element
member.param: the attribute name

member.name: P:Parse.ParseInstallation.CurrentInstallation
member.summary: Gets the ParseInstallation representing this app on this device.

member.name: P:Parse.ParseInstallation.Query
member.summary: Constructs a for ParseInstallations.
member.remarks:
Only the following types of queries are allowed for installations:
query.GetAsync(objectId) query.WhereEqualTo(key, value) query.WhereMatchesKeyInQuery<TOther>(key, keyInQuery, otherQuery)
You can add additional query conditions, but one of the above must appear as a top-level AND clause in the query.

member.name: P:Parse.ParseInstallation.InstallationId
member.summary: A GUID that uniquely names this app installed on this device.

member.name: P:Parse.ParseInstallation.TimeZone
member.summary: The time zone in which this device resides. This string is in the tz database format Parse uses for local-time pushes. Due to platform restrictions, the mapping is less granular on Windows than it may be on other systems. E.g. The zones America/Vancouver America/Dawson America/Whitehorse, America/Tijuana, PST8PDT, and America/Los_Angeles are all reported as America/Los_Angeles.

member.name: P:Parse.ParseInstallation.ParseVersion
member.summary: The version of the Parse SDK used to build this application.

member.name: P:Parse.ParseInstallation.Channels
member.summary: A sequence of arbitrary strings which are used to identify this installation for push notifications. By convention, the empty string is known as the "Broadcast" channel.

member.name: P:Parse.ParseInstallation.DeviceType
member.summary: The runtime target of this application. Is one of winrt, winphone, or dotnet.

member.name: P:Parse.ParseInstallation.AppName
member.summary: The user-friendly display name of this application.

member.name: P:Parse.ParseInstallation.AppIdentifier
member.summary: The system-dependent unique identifier of this installation. This identifier should be sufficient to distinctly name an app on stores which may allow multiple apps with the same display name.

member.name: P:Parse.ParseInstallation.AppVersion
member.summary: A version string consisting of Major.Minor.Build.Revision.
